triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Exceeds Policy Threshold
triageFlags.description: The applicant's Debt-to-Income ratio exceeds the maximum allowable threshold for their credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to affordability concerns.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, the maximum DTI for Tier A applicants is 45%. The applicant's DTI of 55% indicates a significant risk of financial overextension.

triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value Ratio Exceeds Policy Threshold
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio exceeds the maximum allowable threshold for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to non-compliance with loan structure policies.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum LTV of 100% for Tier A applicants. The current LTV of 91.11% is above this limit, indicating a potential risk in asset valuation and loan recovery.

content.reasoning: The applicant's DTI ratio of 55% significantly exceeds the maximum allowable threshold of 45% for their credit tier (Tier A). Additionally, the LTV ratio of 91.11% surpasses the policy limit of 100% for Tier A. These violations indicate a high risk of financial strain and non-compliance with underwriting policies.
